title: Para-Lane: Multi-Lane Dataset Registering Parallel Scans for Benchmarking Novel View Synthesis
author: Ziqian Ni (CaiNiao Inc.), Sicong Du (CaiNiao Inc.), Zhenghua Hou (CaiNiao Inc.), Chenming Wu (Baidu Research), Sheng Yang (CaiNiao Inc.), ...
relevance_why: The methods for novel view synthesis and the dataset curation could help enhance techniques for audio-visual integration, particularly in generating audio from visual inputs.
background: The task focuses on generating realistic novel views from various camera positions in autonomous driving scenarios, particularly in complex multi-lane situations.
contribution: This paper introduces the Para-Lane dataset to solve the lack of realistic multi-lane data for evaluating novel view synthesis capabilities, achieving accurate pose alignment across sequences.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing datasets primarily focus on single-lane or synthetic environments lacking real-world realism.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work provides a multi-pass data collection method and a two-phase pose optimization framework for precise multi-sensor alignment.

key_innovation: Utilizes a combination of LiDAR mapping and camera registration methods to create a comprehensive and realistic benchmark dataset.
real_world_impact: The dataset and methodologies could significantly advance research in autonomous driving by providing valuable benchmarks for evaluating novel view synthesis techniques.
limitations: Some limitations include potential issues with the accuracy of dynamic object segmentation and the need for increased data diversity.

new_terms.Novel View Synthesis (NVS): **Novel View Synthesis (NVS)** refers to generating new images from different viewpoints based on existing captured data, crucial for applications such as autonomous driving.
new_terms.LiDAR (Light Detection and Ranging): **LiDAR** is a technology that measures distances by illuminating a target with laser light and analyzing the reflected light, commonly used in mapping and autonomous vehicles.

open_sourcing: The dataset is publicly available at https://nizqleo.github.io/paralane-dataset/
